auth-group.help: Optionally add an authentication group to restrict access to the WAN Optimization tunnel to peers in the authentication group.
auth-group.name: auth-group

byte-caching.help: Enable/disable byte-caching. Byte caching reduces the amount of traffic by caching file data sent across the WAN and in future serving if from the cache.
byte-caching.name: byte-caching

port.help: Single port number or port number range for CIFS. Only packets with a destination port number that matches this port number or range are accepted by this profile.
port.name: port

prefer-chunking.help: Select dynamic or fixed-size data chunking for WAN Optimization.
prefer-chunking.name: prefer-chunking

options.help: Select dynamic data chunking to help to detect persistent data chunks in a changed file or in an embedded unknown protocol.
options.name: dynamic

protocol-opt.help: Select Protocol specific optimitation or generic TCP optimization.
protocol-opt.name: protocol-opt

secure-tunnel.help: Enable/disable securing the WAN Opt tunnel using SSL. Secure and non-secure tunnels use the same TCP port (7810).
secure-tunnel.name: secure-tunnel

tunnel-sharing.help: Tunnel sharing mode for aggressive/non-aggressive and/or interactive/non-interactive protocols.
tunnel-sharing.name: tunnel-sharing

options.help: For profiles that accept nonaggressive and non-interactive protocols.
options.name: shared

options.help: For profiles that accept interactive protocols such as Telnet.
options.name: express-shared

options.help: For profiles that accept aggressive protocols such as HTTP and FTP so that these aggressive protocols do not share tunnels with less-aggressive protocols.
options.name: private

cifs.help: Enable/disable CIFS (Windows sharing) WAN Optimization and configure CIFS WAN Optimization features.
cifs.name: cifs

byte-caching.name: byte-caching

options.help: Select dynamic data chunking to help to detect persistent data chunks in a changed file or in an embedded unknown protocol.
options.name: dynamic

protocol-opt.name: protocol-opt

secure-tunnel.help: Enable/disable securing the WAN Opt tunnel using SSL. Secure and non-secure tunnels use the same TCP port (7810).
secure-tunnel.name: secure-tunnel

ssl.help: Enable/disable SSL/TLS offloading (hardware acceleration) for traffic in this tunnel.
ssl.name: ssl

tunnel-sharing.help: Tunnel sharing mode for aggressive/non-aggressive and/or interactive/non-interactive protocols.
tunnel-sharing.name: tunnel-sharing

options.help: For profiles that accept nonaggressive and non-interactive protocols.
options.name: shared

options.name: express-shared

options.help: For profiles that accept aggressive protocols such as HTTP and FTP so that these aggressive protocols do not share tunnels with less-aggressive protocols.
options.name: private

ftp.help: Enable/disable FTP WAN Optimization and configure FTP WAN Optimization features.
ftp.name: ftp

byte-caching.help: Enable/disable byte-caching. Byte caching reduces the amount of traffic by caching file data sent across the WAN and in future serving if from the cache.
byte-caching.name: byte-caching

port.help: Single port number or port number range for HTTP. Only packets with a destination port number that matches this port number or range are accepted by this profile.
port.name: port

prefer-chunking.help: Select dynamic or fixed-size data chunking for WAN Optimization.
prefer-chunking.name: prefer-chunking

options.help: Select dynamic data chunking to help to detect persistent data chunks in a changed file or in an embedded unknown protocol.
options.name: dynamic

protocol-opt.help: Select Protocol specific optimitation or generic TCP optimization.
protocol-opt.name: protocol-opt

secure-tunnel.help: Enable/disable securing the WAN Opt tunnel using SSL. Secure and non-secure tunnels use the same TCP port (7810).
secure-tunnel.name: secure-tunnel

ssl.help: Enable/disable SSL/TLS offloading (hardware acceleration) for traffic in this tunnel.
ssl.name: ssl

ssl-port.help: Port on which to expect HTTPS traffic for SSL/TLS offloading.
ssl-port.name: ssl-port

tunnel-non-http.help: Configure how to process non-HTTP traffic when a profile configured for HTTP traffic accepts a non-HTTP session. Can occur if an application sends non-HTTP traffic using an HTTP destination port.
tunnel-non-http.name: tunnel-non-http

options.help: Pass non-HTTP sessions through the tunnel without applying protocol optimization, byte-caching, or web caching. TCP protocol optimization is applied.
options.name: enable

options.help: Drop or tear down non-HTTP sessions accepted by the profile.
options.name: disable

tunnel-sharing.help: Tunnel sharing mode for aggressive/non-aggressive and/or interactive/non-interactive protocols.
tunnel-sharing.name: tunnel-sharing

options.help: For profiles that accept nonaggressive and non-interactive protocols.
options.name: shared

options.help: For profiles that accept interactive protocols such as Telnet.
options.name: express-shared

options.help: For profiles that accept aggressive protocols such as HTTP and FTP so that these aggressive protocols do not share tunnels with less-aggressive protocols.
options.name: private

unknown-http-version.help: How to handle HTTP sessions that do not comply with HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1.
unknown-http-version.name: unknown-http-version

options.help: Reject or tear down HTTP sessions that do not use HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1.
options.name: reject

options.help: Pass HTTP traffic that does not use HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1 without applying HTTP protocol optimization, byte-caching, or web caching. TCP protocol optimization is applied.
options.name: tunnel

options.help: Assume all HTTP sessions comply with HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1. If a session uses a different HTTP version, it may not parse correctly and the connection may be lost.
options.name: best-effort

http.help: Enable/disable HTTP WAN Optimization and configure HTTP WAN Optimization features.
http.name: http

byte-caching.help: Enable/disable byte-caching. Byte caching reduces the amount of traffic by caching file data sent across the WAN and in future serving if from the cache.
byte-caching.name: byte-caching

port.help: Single port number or port number range for MAPI. Only packets with a destination port number that matches this port number or range are accepted by this profile.
port.name: port

secure-tunnel.help: Enable/disable securing the WAN Opt tunnel using SSL. Secure and non-secure tunnels use the same TCP port (7810).
secure-tunnel.name: secure-tunnel

tunnel-sharing.help: Tunnel sharing mode for aggressive/non-aggressive and/or interactive/non-interactive protocols.
tunnel-sharing.name: tunnel-sharing

options.help: For profiles that accept nonaggressive and non-interactive protocols.
options.name: shared

options.help: For profiles that accept interactive protocols such as Telnet.
options.name: express-shared

options.help: For profiles that accept aggressive protocols such as HTTP and FTP so that these aggressive protocols do not share tunnels with less-aggressive protocols.
options.name: private

mapi.help: Enable/disable MAPI email WAN Optimization and configure MAPI WAN Optimization features.
mapi.name: mapi

byte-caching.help: Enable/disable byte-caching. Byte caching reduces the amount of traffic by caching file data sent across the WAN and in future serving if from the cache.
byte-caching.name: byte-caching

byte-caching-opt.help: Select whether TCP byte-caching uses system memory only or both memory and disk space.
byte-caching-opt.name: byte-caching-opt

options.help: Byte caching with memory and disk.
options.name: mem-disk

port.help: Port numbers or port number ranges for TCP. Only packets with a destination port number that matches this port number or range are accepted by this profile.
port.name: port

secure-tunnel.help: Enable/disable securing the WAN Opt tunnel using SSL. Secure and non-secure tunnels use the same TCP port (7810).
secure-tunnel.name: secure-tunnel

ssl.help: Enable/disable SSL/TLS offloading (hardware acceleration) for traffic in this tunnel.
ssl.name: ssl

ssl-port.help: Port numbers or port number ranges on which to expect HTTPS traffic for SSL/TLS offloading.
ssl-port.name: ssl-port

tunnel-sharing.help: Tunnel sharing mode for aggressive/non-aggressive and/or interactive/non-interactive protocols.
tunnel-sharing.name: tunnel-sharing

options.help: For profiles that accept nonaggressive and non-interactive protocols.
options.name: shared

options.help: For profiles that accept interactive protocols such as Telnet.
options.name: express-shared

options.help: For profiles that accept aggressive protocols such as HTTP and FTP so that these aggressive protocols do not share tunnels with less-aggressive protocols.
options.name: private

tcp.help: Enable/disable TCP WAN Optimization and configure TCP WAN Optimization features.
tcp.name: tcp

options.help: Determine if WAN Optimization changes client packet source addresses. Affects the routing configuration on the server network.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable transparent mode. Client packets source addresses are changed to the source address of the FortiGate internal interface. Similar to source NAT.
options.name: disable
